channel.title: No Cache Folder Even Though It Is There
channel.description:
Ok I have Been going to file.store 32 every time runescape updates and I add the new files to my moparscape client OR my windscape client with mopar's "client" class. Then they have the new files.
However, today when I went to put the new cache files in, none of my clients will load because it says no cache folder! get one! but..It is chilling in there anyway and moparscape dont know its there....
[IMG]http://img146.imageshack.us/img146/7976/wtf5ah.png[/img]
all of the cache files are there
I do have the folder
and I did it correctly.
Moparisthebest, I need some help here!
Back on runestatus swift says runescape updated thier framework and the new cache files are not compatable anymore. There is a way to clean up this mess right mopar?

item.title: No Cache Folder Even Though It Is There
item.dc:creator: @yetanothercheater yetanothercheater
item.description:
@yetanothercheater wrote:

I think it's a problem with the path to the files. Which file checks for the location/existence of the "cache" directory?

EDIT:
Okay, I think I've figured it out. You need to run the batch file from the command prompt, and it should work. I'm not sure why it's different running it from the command prompt or from Windows Explorer, but I guess Windows is just weird like that.

Read full topic

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

wow, your computer is messed up some way, either way you can open the batch file and edit it, take out everything but the line with "java" at the start, and you can put a pause after that if you want
